content.description:
Starts out on the far left on good jugs, then traverses inwards as per Skimbles. Move into a knee bar, then through a few slopey pinches made better by a better knee bar. Bump right hand to a slopey pocket, then match, then a fully spread horizontal move to a right crimp, followed by bringing the left foot into a heel hook for a fairly low accuracy left hand bump to a razorblade crimp near the lip. Continue traversing R either through two decent crimps, or, jump to the slopey bread loaf out right and top out. Super fun route!!!

Tis a variation of Monkey Gone to Heaven and Skimbles, that stays predominantly inside the bowl of the boulder.

Stoked to finally send this route out in Indian Cove. Its an extended variation of Skimbles on Pixie Boulder that adds a few harder moves including a rough match, and a low accuracy move to a tiny left razorblade crimp. Two years ago, i fell on the second to last move. Grateful to finally send and surpass my previous self, despite the trials and tribulations of the last years. Yeiiii!!!! Lets go!!
content.location:
Starts in same place as Monkey Gone to Heaven and ends in same place, though the path stays predominantly inside the bowl and only uses the lip once on a tough crimp.

There is one more line on this, maybe v10, that doesnt use the lip at all. Will come back and finish.

content.description: There is a 3-4 foot hole or "womb" on this boulder.  A fun problem is to climb into the "womb" and sit down.  It is much harder than it looks and may not be possible if you are a large person.

SDS at the obvious rail and head up and left to finish with an incut rounded mantle.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
Start at the Pixie Slab Right problem and traverse left. Top-out at the left corner. Do the same thing in reverse and top-out at the right corner. Fun stuff!

Start the same as

Monkey Gone to Heaven

but stay low and make a powerful gaston move to link into the start of

Pixie Dust

and then finish up the fun moves of that problem. For more value continue right and then down along the lip to finish as per

Monkey Gone to Heaven

which may not make it any harder but will certainly add to the pump.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.

SDS at the obvious rail and moves up and onto the left side of the slab. Can be done from a standing start which is about V-easy.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Left side of the West Face.

content.description:
Climbs the rounded right arete starting with a large rounded hold and then traversing up and left along the lip.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
content.location: Right side of the West Face.

content.description:
Climbs the slabby face using a combination of rounded edges and smears. Easy downclimb off the backside.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.
Sit start and climb straight up on far left of pixie boulder north face (right of 'the womb)
Start low with hands matched on an in-cut rail, move up and left to a good pinch and then back right to a good hole before moving over the top. Surprisingly fun movement on this problem.

SDS at the far left side of the North Face and work up and right along huecos and jugs to reach the lip which is traversed past where you'd think to mantle up (V1 if you do) and then contine right and slightly down along the sloping lip to finish with the last moves of

Velouria

.

This problem isn't listed in the Joshua Tree Bouldering Guide but is an obvious line with some good moves that's worth a go when in the area.

Same as Harzie for the first few moves. But once you get underneath the horn do not go left, go directly up and over the horn. You'll have blind feet to work your way up, finishing off with a balancy mantle.
sit start as for "monkey gone to heaven", go left through a low hueco and into a small left facing dihedral, and top out.  one hold is a bit loose.
